docs.lead_paragraph: The case of two families in Siberia has stirred complaints about Russia’s “birth houses,” high-volume operations where women are often treated brusquely.

headline.seo: Russia Stays Transfixed by 12-Year-Olds Switched at Birth
headline.main: Russia Stays Transfixed by a Switch at Birth
headline.print_headline: Russia Stays Transfixed By a Switch At Birth

docs.abstract: Russians are transfixed by the story of two families in Siberia who recently discovered that their two daughters, born within 15 minutes of each other to teenage mothers in adjacent beds in a Siberian 'birth house,' had been delivered to the wrong mothers.
docs.snippet: The case of two families in Siberia has stirred complaints about Russia’s “birth houses,” high-volume operations where women are often treated brusquely.
